data.text: @WDGPublicHealth Downsizing because no one wants your poison.
@Liannabelle88 @stevelanebitch @WDGPublicHealth The library is "dropping" the requirement, oops.
@Liannabelle88 Hi Liannabelle, we recommend contacting the individual settings regarding their proof of vaccine policies.
@WDGPublicHealth Can Dr Mercer comment about the data released by Pfizer today? As they had to by court order?

@Liannabelle88 @stevelanebitch @WDGPublicHealth I've heard from the library last week that they are doing the requirement.

For today I directly know that the rec center is no longer asking for vax proof or even a symptom screen.
@Liannabelle88 @WDGPublicHealth Still waiting 2 years later for the science on masks from Mercer. No wonder the majority do not trust these so called public health officials. https://t.co/F427er97zD
@WDGPublicHealth Pfizer Covid vaccine was just 12% effective against omicron in kids 5 to 11, study finds https://t.co/QCMqW2bGG0

@stevelanebitch @WDGPublicHealth This is posted, now, though it doesn't specify if the library etc are all back to normal. Other municipalities had no vaxports for libraries. Dr Mercer is usually the first or only with such measures.
